meanings.sent1: I routinize my morning by always brushing my teeth first thing.
meanings.sent2: She routinizes her exercise by going for a run every evening.
meanings.sent3: The robot routinized its tasks so well that it started making breakfast for everyone.
meanings.sent4: He routinized his study schedule to be as efficient as a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: Routinizing your chores can help you save time and energy.

meanings.sent1: The new teacher quickly routinized the classroom to create a structured environment.
meanings.sent2: It's important to routinize your workday to increase productivity.
meanings.sent3: The cat routinized its nap schedule to always coincide with the sunny spot on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: She routinized her route to work, never deviating from the familiar path.
meanings.sent5: Routinizing your bedtime can help you get better sleep.

meanings.definition: To make something into a routine.
meanings.sent1: The coach routinized the team's warm-up exercises for consistency.
meanings.sent2: They routinized the process of preparing for their weekly meetings.
meanings.sent3: The magician routinized his tricks to perfection, never missing a step.
meanings.sent4: She routinized her skincare routine to achieve glowing skin.
meanings.sent5: Routinizing your daily tasks can lead to a more organized life.
